items.title: Sumatra’s Deadly Floods May Have Pushed a Rare Ape Closer to the Brink of Extinction
items.description: Nearly three weeks after a cyclone ripped through northern Sumatra, killing hundreds of people, the Indonesian region remains devastated. Towns are cut off and more than 100,000 people have been displaced. items.title: Can a Flood-Prone Coastal City Learn to Live With Water?
